page.title: 14TOURISM PENARTH.
page.content: Penarth, a gracious Victorian seaside resort, is still a popular destination with the day tripper. The town's streets, colourful gardens and parks are the reason for Penarth being called the garden by the sea. Alexandra Park extends from the town centre to the esplanade. The park contains many beautiful shrubs, trees and flower beds. The Windsor and Italian Gardens are other areas of beauty. There is also a municipal bowling green at Belle Vue Park. There is a variety of things to do in the area including sports, disco dancing at the Commodore on the pier, play bingo at the old Washington Cinema, watch theatre groups or shows at the Paget Rooms or perhaps visit the Turner Art Gallery to see fine paintings, bronzes and furniture.
